title: Great tacos and great service. Good place for vegetarian items.
text: Great tacos and great service. Wonderful location about three blocks from the main plaza. There are many wonderful vegetarian options. The papas al horno are a favourite, but all the other tacos we tried were also excellent. Highly recommended

title: Amazing food and service
text: A wonderful Italian restaurant about three blocks from the central plaza. We stumbled across it as we were walking to where we were staying. We love Mexican food, but felt we needed something a bit different for a change. The menu is traditional Italian. We had a caprese salad that was one of the best ever. We also enjoyed an amazing homemade ravioli and a thin crust pizza. The garlic bread was also great. We will be going back to try the some of the seafood on the menu. Good wine selection as well. Many at very reasonable prices. The service was amazing and helpful. Don’t worry if you don’t speak a lot of Spanish as the staff were very fluent in English. The interior was very comfortable and pleasant. Will definitely return.

title: Renovated and wonderful
text: Located on the central main square and newly renovated, this hotel was a great place to stay. The location was great and although other reviewers commented on noise at night, we did not hear anything and our room looked over the square. In fact, the town is surprisingly quiet at night. We took a tour that started at 9 pm and found that there were not many other people around. We found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. I would recommend staying here. This town is very picturesque and definitely worth the visit.

title: Great pizza
text: After all the sausage over the last while we really felt like pizza. We hit the jackpot. Excellent pizza, great service. I will return as the plates of food going by to other tables looked amazing. Particularly the fish dishes. Can’t wait to try them. Highly recommended

title: Potsdam tour - highly recommended
text: This was our first Fat Tire tour, but won’t be our last. The tour company is efficient and provides all the information required. Our guide (Jef) had great communication skills, was knowledgeable and friendly. We learned a lot about Potsdam, the palaces, the gardens, Prussian history and its rulers. Don’t miss it.

title: Good food, lots of conversation, great service
text: A great place for dinner in Charlottenburg. Extensive menu, attentive and friendly service. The caprese salad was very good as was the orchiette pasta with sausage, tomatoes, chilies, garlic. The ravioli stuffed with ricotta and spinach was good if a little bland, but that is common. A good choice.

title: Decent choice in Charlottenburg area
text: Loved the location, nestled in a quiet neighbourhood. Great patio and nice interior seating as well. Service was great and the wait staff were helpful and friendly. The chicken tikka was great. Nicely spiced (medium heat). The lamb with mushrooms and tomatoes was slightly over cooked, a mild/medium spiced heat. The rice and naan were both good. Worth it to sit, watch people go by and have a meal.

title: Deserves to be top rated
text: Wow! One the best meals we have had. We usually go to Keystone Alley which is very good, but the Red Rabbit was recommended by a friend. I feel I owe them a bottle of nice wine as the meal was outstanding. We had the Prix Fixe Menu before the theatre (5 to 7). A la carte can be had afterward. I started with a Frisée salad and then had a crispy duck leg on a bed of mixed vegetables, mushrooms and pickles. Both were to die for. My wife started with a torn mozzarella and pickled rhubarb salad, which was also amazing. Don’t be put off by this unusual combination, it was so amazingly good. There is an extensive wine and cocktail list. Apparently the beer menu changes frequently. I tried a couple of local beers and loved them, particularly the Herald Haus H2 ale. Highly recommended. I also recommend making a reservation so you won’t miss out.

title: Outstanding pub and pub food
text: A very pleasant surprise in Tofino. We wanted pub food so we could watch the Raptors play and this was close by. Great food, great beers and great service, plus many screens to watch the game. Will definitely return.

title: Definitely worth it - make a reservation
text: Three of us had a great dinner. I had the Lingcod, which was absolutely amazing. Perfectly done and delicious. Fish is so often over cooked, but not here. I would go back just for that. The other two meals were also very good. A shrimp dish made to order and the burger were also very good. And don’t forget the bread and spread. Outstanding. Great service and decent wine list. Highly recommended.

title: Buy tickets for the museums before you get there
text: We knew to buy tickets for Tikal National Park at a Banural before we arrived, but didn’t know we also had to buy tickets for the museums. Our own fault, but disappointing nonetheless. Loved the park and recommend going.
place: Tikal Museum / Museo Sylvanus G. Morley

title: Walk, bike, taxi or drive, but go - the food is terrific
text: The short walk, tuk tuk or taxi ride to the South end of Antigua is totally worth it. We went twice, because we enjoyed the food so much. The first time we had pizza, which was amazing. The second time we had the Mediterranean platter which had humus, guacamole, grilled veggies and the best oven roasted flat bread ever. We also had a veggie sandwich on sourdough bread, wonderful oven roasted potatoes and a salad. Both dishes were amazing. There are lots of vegetarian, vegan and gluten free choices as well. There are guided tours of the farm to be booked a day in advance. Don’t miss this place.

title: Don’t forget the tickets for the park and the museums before you go.
text: The park is great as everyone says, so I’ll stick to some suggestions. First buy tickets for the park in advance at any Banural location. If you are in Antigua first, there is a less busy Banural on the second floor of a building on the corner of 3a Avenida Norte and 4 Calle Oriente. If you want to go to the museums at the park, you also need to buy tickets in advance. There is a kiosk at the airport in Flores if you are flying to the park. FYI, it is an hour to 1 1/2 hours drive from Flores to Tikal. Hope that helps. It is so worth it.

title: If you’re tired of ‘tipico’ try this place
text: This restaurant serves all manner of crepes. Traditional French, but many others, savoury or sweet. The sign at the door reads that the restaurant has the best cooks, but the worst patio. In reality, the food is very good and the roof top patio is great. This restaurant was recommended by a Guatemalan couple and we were very glad we went.

title: View great, food good, shuttle a problem
text: This small place is worth a visit, the food is decent and there is the view of the valley. You can hike up, but it was a very steep 3 Km from the bottom. You can catch the shuttle from Nim Po’t Textile Centre on 5a Avenida Norte for 10 Quetzales return. We had been informed that the shuttle goes every 20 minutes. Waited 30 minutes for the pick up at the store. Should have clued in at that point, but we were on holidays and thought a few minutes wasn’t a big deal. When we arrived at the Cerro, was told that when we were ready to leave, all we had to do was ask the waiter to call and the shuttle would arrive in 20 minutes. An hour and a half after calling, it arrived. All it would have taken was a bit more communication, could have ordered an extra beer to while away the time or called a taxi.

title: Wonderful place to see and stroll through
text: I loved this place. Rather than start at the luxury hotel, enter the museum on Avenida 1a and begin your tour at the old pharmacy museum. The entrance fee here is 40 Q, versus 48 Q at the hotel, unless you are staying at the hotel, which gives you free entrance. You walk through many ruins of churches, a convent and crypts, but for me the highlight was the PreColumbian exhibit of statues and pottery curated by subject and situated beside modern glassworks. For example, ancient statues of eagles were beside a modern glasswork of an eagle in the same display case. There are equally impressive displays of snakes, rabbits, crocodiles and other subjects. Wonderful curation. Highly recommended.

title: An incredible lunch
text: Deserves many repeat visits. We loved the quinoa salad, humus and vegetarian curry. Huge choice of smoothies and other drinks. Excellent spot for vegetarians. Great service, reasonable prices. Highly recommended

title: Intriguing as you walk by
text: The bubbling pots of stews, soups and cauldrons full of ribs, rice, beans and plates of fish and spinach pies at the entrance was enough to entice us into this restaurant for dinner. The four of us tried the chicken in black bean sauce, pork stew, ribs, spinach pie, rice, beans to name a few. The ribs were good, the chicken was deemed okay, the spinach pie was good as was the bean and rice dish. The pork stew also got mixed reviews. Some of the rice dishes were dry. For 80 Quetzals you had one main and two sides. The service was good and the explanation of the dishes was very helpful.

title: A great spot for lunch
text: A lovely little café and bakery. I love cinnamon so a café with that name beckoned to me. It was very pleasant sitting in the courtyard, looking at the flowers and listening to the water flowing in the fountain while having lunch. The avocado toast with egg and the vegetarian panini were both very good. We also succumbed and had dessert. Worth every calorie. The service was excellent and allowed me to practice my Spanish, yet spoke perfect English. Will definitely return soon.

title: Deserves to be a success
text: Recently opened, this restaurant deserves a visit. The menu is extensive and includes culinary influences reflective of Persian history. The baba ganoush was amazing and the accompanying naan was warm, soft and delicious. The vegetable kabob was grilled to perfection. The lamb kabob was tasty. A Persian stew with chicken in a pomegranate sauce with walnuts and spices was tangy and sweet. The accompanying saffron rice was very good. The only regret was not being able to try some of the other menu items. Vegetarian and vegan options were available. Service was great and the waiter was very knowledgeable. A repeat visit is definitely on the agenda.

title: Our favourite hotel in Greece
text: This hotel and associated restaurant deserve the highest ratings. The place is lovely, great rooms, a terrific pool large enough for decent lap swimming, a great restaurant and perhaps most important, amazing staff. And of course very close to several great beaches for sunning, swimming or a long walk along the beaches or through the cedar forest. About 25 Km South of Hora (Naxos Town), it is peaceful, not crowded, yet has easy access to everything you would want and for touring the island. We spent our days walking, swimming, sunning and/or visiting Hora, touring the countryside and visiting villages and historic sites and then returning to have a wonderful meal in their restaurant. Pickups from the airport or sea port can be arranged. Highly recommended for those that want all that Naxos has to offer, while avoiding the busier nature of staying in Hora. Can’t wait to go back.

title: Expensive but convenient
text: Nice hotel, surprisingly quiet given the proximity to the airport. The service was good, rooms decent, excellent bathrooms with one of the best shower/tub combinations. Staff were helpful and the restaurant food was quite good. An issue for us was the restriction to the number of devices per room for WiFi access. Given we both have smart phones and tablets, allowing only 3 devices to access the internet required some planning. The indoor pool was too small for lap swimming.

title: Great lunch - worth the walk from Oia
text: Located in Finikia, it is a 10 to 15 minute walk from Oia, but definitely worth it. The view is of the sea on the North coast of the island. Not as spectacular as the caldera views, but sitting on the roof top away from the crowds was terrific. We were there for lunch and had the best eggplant I have ever tasted. We also shared the special salad ( not the typical Greek salad ) and really enjoyed it. Highly recommended.

title: Good lunch and dinner
text: We were staying in Finikia so decided to try all three restaurants here. We had lunch and dinner here and enjoyed both meals. The service was good both times. We had the eggplant salad, saganaki and Greek salad for lunch. My wife thought it was the best eggplant salad and bread on our trip ( I liked the eggplant salad at Meze Meze better ). For the dinner we tried the kokonisto ( beef stew ) and the Greek version of spaghetti bolognese. Both were great. The seasoning in the bolognese was particularly good. Of course there is a scrumptious dessert ( on the house ). If you are staying in Oia, it is certainly worth the short walk away from the hordes there. Because it is an old Greek village with a maze of small paths, watch for the signs.

title: Great dinner - reserve if possible
text: We went for dinner at 7:45 p.m. and we got one of the last tables available without a reservation. The food was amazing and the staff were great. The waiters were busy and rushing everywhere, but we never felt rushed or pushed at any time. We had the stuffed eggplant and lamb chops. Both were absolutely delicious. As usual at many Crete restaurants we were given a delicious custard dessert and Raki on the house. Highly recommended.

title: Great place for lunch or early dinner - casual, family atmosphere
text: This restaurant was recommended by our hotel across the street and it was very good. It is only open during the day, closing at 8 p.m. They have daily specials in addition to standard menu items. Two of us shared a seasonal salad and a pumpkin pie ( the savoury kind, not the sweet dessert). Both were excellent and the portions were quite large. The staff were very helpful, encouraging us to view the open kitchen and explaining the menu. It is very busy, but turnover is fairly good. Highly recommended.

title: A good choice away from the craziness of downtown, but close enough to enjoy all the sites
text: We stayed for a few nights at the start of our trip and for one night after a tour of the mainland. Listed as a 5 star, at first I thought it didn’t deserve the ranking. Then we stayed at some 4 star hotels after and I revised my internal ranking and boosted it up a notch. The room was fine, great bathroom, lots of space and importantly, quiet at night. The WiFi wasn’t the best, but certainly adequate. The roof top pool was great. Not huge, but still good for some laps. Drinks at the pool side bar were two to three times the price compared to the restaurants virtually next door. We really liked the location. Away from the noise and bustle from the city centre, yet easily accessible to all the main sites. Situated on Caravel Square, there were lots of restaurants near by. We walked to the centre a couple of times, but when we were tired the taxis were very reasonable. Usually 5 Euros. The staff were great. Attentive, friendly and helpful. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

title: Great view, food average
text: Loved the view, sitting on the cliff side overlooking the bay, full moon rising. That part was definitely worth it. My sea bass was fairly good and I liked the tomato/caper salad that was an accompaniment. My wife’s shrimp were over cooked and tasteless. The Cretan wine was nice. A small glass of Raki and a cheesecake (on the house) completed our meal. The staff were very pleasant.
place: SCALA Fish Bar Restaurant & Hotel Boutique

title: Best lunch on our trip
text: We stumbled upon this place when driving around the area surrounding Anogia. We had just seen the Sfendoni Caves in Zoniana and decided to go to Axos to see what was there. We spotted the restaurant higher up the mountain and thought the view would be worth the visit. Best decision in a long time. The lunch was simply amazing. We shared the Oaxis salad ( lettuce, grilled pork, dried figs amongst other ingredients and a terrific dressing ) which came in an edible bowl of sesame seeds, slivered almonds and honey. We also shared what we thought would be a plate of bread and meats, but turned out to be like a pizza on a flat bread. Also delicious. The portions were quite large. The service was excellent, staff extremely friendly. Highly recommended.

title: Great, small museum
text: Visit the museum before going to the site, so that you have a greater appreciation of the site. There are a number of very interesting statues and artifacts in the museum, some unique to this museum. Highly recommended

title: Spectacular - lots of climbing, but worth it
text: There was more here than I realized. The site is huge and certainly worth the climb up to see all of it. Arrive early or wait until late in the afternoon due to the huge number of tour buses. Suggest visiting the museum first so you have a better appreciation of what was there as you walk through the ruins

title: A hotel full of tour buses
text: A decent enough hotel, not sure if 3 or 4 star. On the outskirts of the village, but easily walkable in 5 to10 minutes. The village is cute and has tremendous views of the valley if you have time. Breakfasts and dinner are the typical buffet style with all the same menu items. Lots of choice, but average. Confusing room numbering, but the elevators do indicate which floors belong to which room numbers. Good swimming pool. Staff are pleasant but frequently rushed and scurrying around with the huge number of tour buses that arrive at the same time.

title: A must see, but so very crowded.
text: Go very early or very late. The phrase ‘hordes of people’ does not do justice to the mass of humanity struggling to get to the top. Still, you must go. It is truly awe inspiring. I recommend going to the Acropolis Museum first so that you have a better idea of the architectural feats, sculptures, artistry and history of the site.

title: Go here before going to the Acropolis
text: A terrific museum, easy to access, tour and understand. We went to the Acropolis first, but I think that I would have gotten more out of that tour if I had been to this museum first. The way they display the sculptures associated with the pediments really added to my understanding of the splendour of the site.

title: Lots of people, lots of restaurants and shops
text: You have to go to see it, but be warned that it is very crowded. If you like to shop this is one of the areas to visit. There are lots of pedestrian only streets which makes it better and with the streets so narrow, you can easily avoid the sun when very hot.

title: Great choice on Caravel Square
text: We were in Athens for five days and ate here twice. Chose it the first time due to the proximity of our hotel. Went the second time because the food was decent and the staff exceptional. The staff were always warm, cheerful, friendly and attentive. There are lots of restaurants on the square and this one is certainly worth a try. Many choose to sit inside but we preferred the tables across the narrow street nestled under the trees in the square. Very pleasant, even when the sun is beating down. As others have commented, we ordered only drinks and the main course and we received complementary soup and dessert. In essence they were probably included in determining the cost per dish, but still was nice to have. The moussaka was terrific. We also had the beef ribs one night and the roasted lamb the other night. Both were good, not exceptional but good. Less then 50 Euros for two people each night. All in all, I would recommend.

title: Outstanding- Deserves the #1 rating
text: One of the best meals in a very long time. The service was great, all staff were attentive and personable. The food was cooked to perfection and delicious. I had the aged cheddar and roasted red pepper pork and loved every bite. The vegetables accompanying were perfectly cooked and also delicious. My three companions had the chicken supreme special, stuffed with quinoa, cranberries etc and all raved about it. This restaurant would be a success in any city.

title: Great place for lunch
text: The staff are helpful, attentive and friendly. The food is amazing. The soup was outstanding, the wraps and sandwiches were delicious and the pie was the best ever. This is the place to stop on the way to the lake country.
place: Yellow Fender Coffee House and Bistro

title: Beautiful old house, wonderful place to stay
text: A spectacular place to stay. It is worth it just to see the house on the inside. The woodwork, windows, stained glass are all fabulous and immaculately kept. We were in the second floor suite. It was enormous with a big comfortable bed, a separate sitting area, lovely bathroom and even a walk-in closet. The WiFi was very good. Breakfasts of fresh fruit, yoghurt, eggs etc were great. The hosts are wonderful. This B and B is among the best.

title: Deserves the #1 rank
text: One of the best hotels where we have stayed. The staff are outstanding. Service oriented and friendly. We had a 1 BR suite with a view of the river. Very well appointed. Great bed, probably the best ever. Great bathroom with lots of light. The breakfast was also outstanding with lots of selection. The WiFi was a little slow, but that is the only small issue we had. Free parking right outside the door is definitely a plus. Walking distance to shopping, museums, restaurants. The walking/running/biking path along the river is across the street. Highly recommended

title: Excellent choice overall
text: Nestled within the University, this restaurant has much to recommend it. If the weather is nice leave time for a stroll of the gardens before or after your meal. The restaurant is well appointed and comfortable. The service was amazing. Our waitress was simply outstanding. Two of us had the lamb shank, which was terrific. The West African Peanut Stew and the Vegan Meatloaf (an oxymoron?) were both considered to be excellent by our table mates. The dessert was the only disappointment. Overall a great choice.

title: Great spot for lunch, coffee, light dinner
text: Very good salads and paninis. Our party of four had the spicy chicken panini, Greek feta panini and the salad with strawberries, nuts topped with grilled chicken. All were extremely tasty. Has a Lovely back patio. Lots of choices of coffee, teas, cold drinks, beers. Highly recommended.

title: Service good, limonada good, tacos not so good
text: A great location close to the centre. We went for a late lunch/early dinner as we had a walking tour organized for the early evening. The staff were pleasant and got added points for letting me use my limited Spanish. The limonadas could be ordered with or without sugar and both were good. The tacos were a huge disappointment. We had the barbacoa fish tacos and the al mojo fish tacos. The al mojo were so loaded with garlic that they were not edible. The barbacoa tacos were over cooked and dry. The salsas didn’t add anything but heat. Perhaps this was a one off experience, but there are so many good restaurants in all price ranges in San Miguel that at this time I can not recommend this one.

title: Enjoyed our lunch tremendously
text: Such a pleasant surprise. We were on a day trip to Querétaro and our guide suggested we stop here for lunch. The day was sunny and hot, but under the umbrellas it was very pleasant. The service was outstanding. As others have mentioned the menu is eclectic. My wife and I shared a cheese board and a salad. The cheese board had five different types of cheeses, Serrano ham and fruit. The salad had arugula, spinach, carmelized nuts, grilled asparagus and goat cheese. Both were wonderful. Accompanied by locally brewed cervezas and mineral water, we couldn’t have asked for a better place to sit, eat, drink and enjoy the lovely plaza.

title: Best place for coffee, pastries, limonada or sandwiches in San Miguel
text: The pastries are tremendous, the coffees excellent and the limonada is made on the spot with or without sugar or as requested. We first went three years ago and loved it and was so glad that everything is just as good or even better.

title: The best cooking class ever.
text: The title says it all ‘ The best cooking class ever ‘. Great market tour, great food, great fun, great conversation. Paco is knowledgeable, personable and an incredible chef. We have been fortunate to have been on market tours in many countries and although this market was not the largest, without a doubt it was the most enjoyable tour we have had. Paco’s love of the food and the people came through in every encounter. We made tamales, empanadas, pozole and a chocolate/tequila desert that all six of us said was the best Mexican food we have ever tasted and perhaps the best meal ever. I wish there was the ability to give six stars. Do not miss this.

title: This a real find
text: In a slightly hidden courtyard near the corner of Zacateros and Canal, this pleasant coffee shop/restaurant is one of our favourite places in San Miguel. Close to the central plaza (El Jardin), but sheltered from the noise. We stopped in for almuerzo (early lunch) and really enjoyed the food, service and ambiance. We shared the fruit plate and the tostadas de hummus. Both were excellent as was the café con leche. We will definitely return.

title: Great food, great service
text: The bar was packed, but the restaurant had a couple of tables available on a Friday night. The service was just right, attentive not overbearing. My wife had a stacked vegetarian and cheese tortilla that she loved. I ordered the pork tenderloin with blackberry sauce. Perfectly cooked to my specifications and delicious, flavourful, but not sweet. Surprisingly, it was the whole tenderloin. The side of green beans with almonds was also perfectly cooked and also delicious. All in all, one of the best meals I’ve had recently.
place: Hank's New Orleans Cafe & Oyster Bar

title: Worth a return visit or two
text: As everyone indicates, eat on the roof top terrace. Great food, good selection of beverages. The fish tacos are terrific. We had tilapia, spicy shrimp and marlin tacos. All were delicious. Will try some of the other dishes on our next visit. This has a casual, welcoming atmosphere. So nice after walking through the busy central plaza.

title: Will have to change my ranking scale - this restaurant is the best, others will go down a notch.
text: The best tapas ever. Nice decor, great ambience, friendly and efficient staff and great food. Recommended by a close friend who lived in Spain until recently. Easy to get to by metro (near Bilbao stop). Not your typical tourist tapas. Much, much better. We had quekas (like a quesadilla), humus made from edamame and tofu on top of homemade crackers, camarones in a curry sauce and a house favourite of baozi de cebón. Then dessert was amazing. A cheese cake and an apple crumble with cinnamon ice cream. A bonus because you can reserve on line. Will come back to Madrid just for this.

title: Great choice on a street filled with restaurants
text: We went on a Friday evening at 8:30 and were lucky to find a table. Shortly after this it was full. The menu is not a type tapas menu, it has some familiar items such as patatas bravas. We tried the avocado and palm hearts salad, the mexican burrito abs the cachapas (corn pancakes with fillings). Loved all three. Service was great.

title: Had lunch twice here and loved it
text: We stumbled on this place when roaming near the Palacio Real and the cathedral. About a block North of Calle mayor, it is nestled in a tiny plaza (Biombo) away from the tourist hustle and bustle so you can talk, yet so close to these important sights. The food is good and the service excellent. Highly recommended. The caprese salad and eggplant ratatouille were great.

title: A must see - look for automated ticket machines
text: This is truly an amazing place. Go see it. It has all been said, so I will just add my suggestion regarding the tickets. When we arrived, I noticed a long line at the ticket booth, but if you glance to the left of the booth there are two small automatic ticket machines. A short line up, fast and easy. The audio guides are bought separately in a booth to the right of the ticket booth.

title: Great food, great service
text:
Nestled in a courtyard, this restaurant has a wonderful atmosphere. The food and service are both excellent. The salads are great and if you order the full size, it is more than enough for 2 to 3 people. The salmorejo and the beef sirloin strip are also wonderful. If you are fortunate their 18 year old ginger cat may make an appearance
We went twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. Both great

title: Great room, great staff, spectacular view
text: We loved it. We had a junior suite which was spacious and had an enormous bed, chesterfield, chairs, an ottoman, dresser, a large closet (lots of hangers) and a safe to name some of the amenities. The bathroom was also large with good lighting and a large shower encased on three sides in marble. On top of this, the view was amazing. The staff was also great: friendly and extremely helpful. Would definitely return.

title: Great tapas with a difference
text: It was suggested by two different staff members at our hotel as a place that both locals and tourists go. The food was amazing. The cod with parsley sauce and the grilled vegetables tapas were both outstanding. We arrived a short time after opening, which is 8:30 and got one of the last tables inside ( it was a cool night, so the outside tables were left to more hardy folk ). It quickly filled with a wide range of people including four young families with babies and strollers. A fun time with lots of conversation, great food and wine. Highly recommended.

title: Good food on the street or in a quiet, cool courtyard
text: This taberna has tables outside, inside the bar area and up a few steps into an interior courtyard. Depending upon your mood and the temperature outside, this bar/restaurant has great options. The menu has many Andalusian and North African items. The chicken kabobs are very good, the chicken with plums and almonds is great, the humus is fabulous . The service is great (many languages spoken) and you can reserve on-line. The best part is that you can avoid the crowds in the Cathedral and main plaza areas. Highly recommended.

title: Wonderful palacio, definitely worth a visit
text: This is a great way to spend an hour or more to see treasures lovingly placed throughout the casa. The floor and wall mosaics and relics from Roman times, furniture and ceramics from France, Spain and England, the library of 6,000 books and the Casa itself are a must see in Sevilla. Recommend spending the extra 3 euros for the guided tour of the primera planta.
place: Museo Palacio de la Condesa de Lebrija

title: Spectacular, but plan your visit ahead of time
text: An amazing place to tour and definitely worth the time. We were there mid-October and the line up to get in without a pre-purchased ticket was huge. Go early morning and line up before it opens ( and you will be in the shade ) or very late in the afternoon. There are actually 3 lines: one for on-line tickets, one for groups and one for those of us who did not remember to pre-book. At times it is hard to know which is which. Regardless, don’t miss this. Believe all the positive descriptions. After the tour, relax and enjoy a coffee under the shade of the trees at the cafe inside.

title: Cathedrals blend together in your mind, but this one stands out
text: Definitely worth the visit. The lineups are long, so plan your tour. If you go an hour before it closes, the lineups are much, much shorter.
